Problem 85. Suppose that A is an open subset of [0, 1]2 with measure α. Are there four points in A determining an axis-parallel rectangle with area ⩾ cα2?

Comments. This is often known as ‘Carbery’s rectangle problem’, though it appears in a joint paper of Carbery, Christ and Wright. See [56, Section 6]. It is quite easy to show using Cauchy-Schwarz that there must be such a rectangle with area ≫ α2(log 1/α)−1.
